1.text: Paul, an apostle—not from men, nor through man, but through Jesus Christ, and God the Father, who did raise him out of the dead—

2.text: and all the brethren with me, to the assemblies of Galatia:

3.text: Grace to you, and peace from God the Father, and our Lord Jesus Christ,

4.text: who did give himself for our sins, that he might deliver us out of the present evil age, according to the will of God even our Father,

5.text: to whom is the glory to the ages of the ages. Amen.

6.text: I wonder that ye are so quickly removed from Him who did call you in the grace of Christ to another good news;

7.text: that is not another, except there be certain who are troubling you, and wishing to pervert the good news of the Christ;

8.text: but even if we or a messenger out of heaven may proclaim good news to you different from what we did proclaim to you—anathema let him be!

9.text: as we have said before, and now say again, If any one to you may proclaim good news different from what ye did receive—anathema let him be!

10.text: for now men do I persuade, or God? or do I seek to please men? for if yet men I did please—Christ’s servant I should not be.

11.text: And I make known to you, brethren, the good news that were proclaimed by me, that it is not according to man,

12.text: for neither did I from man receive it, nor was I taught it, but through a revelation of Jesus Christ,

13.text: for ye did hear of my behaviour once in Judaism, that exceedingly I was persecuting the assembly of God, and wasting it,

14.text: and I was advancing in Judaism above many equals in age in mine own race, being more abundantly zealous of my fathers’ deliverances,

15.text: and when God was well pleased—having separated me from the womb of my mother, and having called me through His grace—

16.text: to reveal His Son in me, that I might proclaim him good news among the nations, immediately I conferred not with flesh and blood,

17.text: nor did I go up to Jerusalem unto those who were apostles before me, but I went away to Arabia, and again returned to Damascus,

18.text: then, after three years I went up to Jerusalem to enquire about Peter, and remained with him fifteen days,

19.text: and other of the apostles I did not see, except James, the brother of the Lord.

20.text: And the things that I write to you, lo, before God—I lie not;

21.text: then I came to the regions of Syria and of Cilicia,

22.text: and was unknown by face to the assemblies of Judea, that are in Christ,

23.text: and only they were hearing, that ‘he who is persecuting us then, doth now proclaim good news—the faith that then he was wasting;’

24.text: and they were glorifying God in me.
